title: Comparative Analysis and Application Strategies of Case-Based Learning (CBL) and Problem-Based Learning (PBL)

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational knowledge of pedagogy and general understanding of educational methods
context.additional_context: A course for pre-service and in-service teachers designed to clarify differences between CBL and PBL, cultivate abilities to apply these in real educational settings, and strengthen self-directed learning and case analysis skills

learning_goals: Learners can explain core concepts, structures, and implementation methods of CBL and PBL with over 80% accuracy.
Learners can propose at least three differentiated strategies for applying CBL and PBL in real educational scenarios.
Learners can collaboratively develop CBL/PBL learning materials and exchange feedback with peers using LMS-based collaboration tools.

resources: LMS Platform (Including Discussion Board & Resource Sharing Features)
CBL/PBL Comparative Example Video & Text Materials
Online Collaboration Tools (Google Docs, Padlet, etc.)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
